definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: Luld cs loathes expressionism and modernist art, but advocates realism.
sentences.chinese: 他憎恶表现主义和现代派艺术，提倡现实主义。

sentences.english: Some love minimalist design, and would splash out on modern minimalist furniture.
sentences.chinese: 有些爱极简设计，愿意在现代派极简家具上挥金如土。

sentences.english: He Qifang is one of the most important contemporary poets in the 1930 in China.
sentences.chinese: 何其芳是我国三十年代现代派诗歌的重要诗人之一。

sentences.english: This tapestry's pattern is very modern.
sentences.chinese: 这块壁毯的图案很有现代派的味道。

sentences.english: The bright modern painting stares out at you in the otherwise conservative gallery.
sentences.chinese: 有些古典派画廊也会陈列出明亮色彩的现代派绘画。

sentences.english: The purpose and the style of every Taiwan's modern poet are different.
sentences.chinese: 台湾每个现代派诗人都有独特的追求，风格千姿百态。

sentences.english: The pluralizing of minoritarian literature and its poetics is one of the most important features in American postmodernism.
sentences.chinese: 后现代派小说是二十世纪美国文学的主要体裁。

sentences.english: In chinese free-style verse modernism is adroit at creating images.
sentences.chinese: 在中国新诗史上，“现代派”是营造意象的高手。

sentences.english: The event will be the new school scene villas additional brilliance.
sentences.chinese: 该楼盘将为西郊别墅区增添现代派的新光彩。

sentences.english: The West Modernist School's non-rational imagination has also lost the foundation that can be understood.
sentences.chinese: 西方现代派的非理性想象也失去了被理解的土壤。

sentences.english: Kawabata is one of the pioneers of modernism in Japanese literature.
sentences.chinese: 川端康成是日本文学现代派的开山祖师之一。

sentences.english: The second is of a modernistic style.
sentences.chinese: 第二首是现代派的画风。

sentences.english: Many modernists think that rhyme and metre hamper the poet's free expression. ;
sentences.chinese: 很多现代派诗人认为韵律妨碍了诗人的自由发挥。

sentences.english: Kafkaesque is a famous contemporary novelist of Austria and one of the originators of modernist school of literature.
sentences.chinese: 卡夫卡是奥地利现代著名小说家，现代派文学的鼻祖。

sentences.english: The modernist school literature of the west in the 20th century has the spiritual substance of counter tradition.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪西方现代派文学具有反传统的精神实质。

sentences.english: Well, the word "modernist" is code for non-believer.
sentences.chinese: 这个嘛，“现代派”指不信教的人。

definition: decadents (of the Decadent movement of late 19th century Europe)
Misty Poetry, a post-Cultural Revolution poetry movement
